conclusion: Analyze the motion of blocks a and b, including initial conditions, collision, and subsequent motion.
Use conservation of energy to find velocity of block b just before collision.
Potential energy at highest point is converted into kinetic energy at lowest point.
Calculate velocity of block b using mgh = 1/2 mv_b^2.
Determine velocity of block a after collision using conservation of momentum and kinetic energy.
Collision is elastic, velocities satisfy conservation equations.
Set up equations for conservation of momentum and kinetic energy.
Solve for v_a using quadratic formula.
Magnitude of velocity v_0 of block a immediately after collision is 6.34 m/s.
